story:
On the 22nd of October we sadly said goodbye to our mam and loving wife, who lost her fight to cancer. She fought so hard right to the very end with the help and support of her family, friends and Macmillan cancer support. We cannot thank Chez's Macmillan nurse, Louise, enough. She has been so helpful and caring and gone above and beyond and Chez absolutely adored her. So for this reason we have decided to open a just giving page to raise money for Macmillan Cancer Support in memory of our Chez. They really made a difference and we hope we can help them continue to do the amazing job they do. We thank you for any donations made 

All our love

Stephen, Dean, Abbey and Pip xxx

charity.description: Macmillan nurses, doctors and health professionals will continue to support people living with cancer whilst doing all they can to help alleviate the immense strain put on the NHS by coronavirus. Please donate today to help make sure we can keep delivering all our critical services.
charity.name: Macmillan Cancer Support
story:
Thanks for supporting my fundraising. Macmillan Cancer Support is here to help everyone with cancer live life as fully as they can, providing physical, financial and emotional support.  Cancer has struck my family a number of times, and each time Macmillan have been there.  We could not have managed without them.

To mark my sixth decade, I am planning to learn, and play, all 45 chorale preludes in Bach's Orgelbuchlein across the year, starting and finishing on my birthday. Bach originally planned to write 164 such preludes, marking every season of the year, although in the event he only completed 45.  So far as possible, I will play each prelude either in concert or at a church service on the relevant Sunday.  Where that is not possible, I will post the prelude on You Tube.  

And because it is my sixth decade, I would be delighted if I were able to reach £600 to support the wonderful work that Macmillan do for so many charities.

Thanks for reading this, perhaps listening to my Bach, and for even the smallest contribution you may wish to make; it really does all help to make a huge difference.
title: Mark's Bach

story:
As most of you are aware my stepdad Clive lost his fight to cancer on the 23rd October 2020. He fought so hard all the way through the intital diagnosis first time and even harder when he was given his terminal diagnosis. He was so loved by all his family and those that didn't even know him, he left his Clive mark everywhere he went. Its only right that I do something in his memory, Clive and everyone that knows me, knows exercise is not my strong point but I want a challenge.

Thank you in advance

Hannah xx

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. 

Pramod was a loving son, brother and uncle, as well as being a wonderful friend to so many. He had only turned 50 this year and we sadly lost him too young. He was one of a kind and always had the ability to make us laugh. We discovered that he had suffered from a heart attack and this was due to having the silent condition, Ischemic heart disease. With these donations, we would like to help those suffering with similar conditions and feel that it will help to raise awareness and save the lives of others. Donations of any size will be equally and greatly appreciated. Thank you from all of the family.

charity.description: With your support, we aim to fund over £100 million of research each year into all heart and circulatory diseases and the things that cause them. Heart diseases. Stroke. Vascular dementia. Diabetes. They're all connected, and they're all under our microscope. Together we can beat heartbreak forever.
charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
We sadly lost my Grandad, Colin Mason (Big G), at the age of 82 in the early hours of Thursday 22nd October 2020. 

He was a wonderfully caring man with a strong personality and will be sorely missed by his wife, daughters, grandchildren, great grandchildren and friends. 

Grandad has suffered with problems to his heart over many years, more recently receiving treatment in Scarborough Hospital and Castle Hill in Hull. He defied the odds given to him by his doctors from his 30's to reach the age of 82, which is a testament to his strong, determined and sometimes stubborn character. We love him dearly and have decided to raise funds for the British Heart Foundation in his memory, to hopefully aid the important work and research they undertake to help those like grandad.
title: In Memory of Colin Mason
rememberedPersonSummary.name: Colin Mason
pageSummary: Raising money in memory of Colin Mason because of the important work and research they undertake.
pageSummaryWhat: Raising money in memory of Colin Mason
pageSummaryWhy: of the important work and research they undertake.

charity.description: With your support, we aim to fund over £100 million of research each year into all heart and circulatory diseases and the things that cause them. Heart diseases. Stroke. Vascular dementia. Diabetes. They're all connected, and they're all under our microscope. Together we can beat heartbreak forever.
charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
The pandemic is the biggest challenge weve faced in our 60 year history. And its led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, weve never needed people like you more. 

Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into groundbreaking science and support for the people who need us most. Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the worlds biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we cant drop the ball now.
title: Dechox 2020

charity.description: With your support, we aim to fund over £100 million of research each year into all heart and circulatory diseases and the things that cause them. Heart diseases. Stroke. Vascular dementia. Diabetes. They're all connected, and they're all under our microscope. Together we can beat heartbreak forever.
charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation and I'd be so grateful for your support. 

As some of you know back in Jan 2020 my dad suffered 5 heart attacks without realising they were heart attacks (classic dad was taking Renes thinking he had heartburn) after suffering with chest pains one day at work a first aider phoned an ambulance - this is where our lives changed. 

He was rushed to hospital to be checked over where they detailed just how lucky he was to be alive. They showed us how he had 5 heart attacks over the past 2 weeks with the technology available - without fundraising this technology wouldn't be around. 

A week of testing diagnosed 3 blocked main arteries to his heart. We're not too sure how long he has been living with just 2 arteries but his body was slowly giving up. Stents were not an option as the arteries were pretty much dead. After being told there was nothing Kettering general was able to do for him the wait started for a bed over at Glenfield Hospital in Leicester. 2 weeks later we received the call to say the bed was free and an ambulance was on route to take him. 

Over at Glenfield they detailed the operation he needed. Open heart surgery of a triple heart bypass. Despite everyone telling you how routine these operations are the worry we faced as a family was nothing short of horrendous.  Luckily our wait was less than a week and dad was off for his 5 hour operation. 

The longest day of our lives fell on Valentines day 2020 - but that evening we received the news the Op had gone well and he was in ICU recovering. 2 days later we went to visit and it was heartbreaking to see my dad suffering the effects of open heart surgery. However classic dad had us all laughing and joking within no time - 4 days post op he was up walking and just short of a week after surgery he was ready to come home. 

The frail old guy in these photos is what we brought home with us - the guy who was the man of the house unable to even walk unaided but the support my mum has given him over the past 8 months  - we have our dad back! He is even growing a little belly now too. He has been so spoiled by her! 

Before this year I could literally run when playing rugby - and this wasn't a lot. However 3 stone lighter this year I completed my first 10k in less than an hour so i felt now was the right time to set myself the challenge of a half marathon while raising some cash for the cause that saved our dads life. 

 Just to give you an idea the BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. Thanks!
title: Daryl & Dave's Half Marathon

charity.description: We fundraise to enhance Great Ormond Street Hospital’s ability to transform the health and wellbeing of children and young people. Donations help to fund advanced medical equipment, child and family support services, pioneering research and rebuilding and refurbishment.
charity.name: Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity
eventName: Great Yarmouth & Lowestoft Premier Inn Walks
story:
The team at Great Yarmouth & Lowestoft Premier Inns are committed to their continued fundraising efforts for the fantastic work done at Great Ormond Street Hospital & will be completing a number of sponsored walks/runs to due the challenges faced fundraising in the COVID-19 pandemic.

Great Ormond Street Hospital supports seriously ill children from all over the UK. Every day 619 children and young people arrive at GOSH to receive care and life saving treatments to ensure they can continue to lead healthy lives. Since 2012, Premier Inn and Restaurants have been proud partners of Great Ormond Street Hospital Charity and we know our passionate teams have taken part in many brilliant fundraising events as well as volunteering at national events around the country and at the hospital.During these uncertain times our teams continue to achieve incredible things, challenging themselves to conquer their Everest and take care of their wellbeing. We are looking to continue the fantastic fundraising achieved through our partnership by supporting our teams in their creative and dedicated ways of personal achievement. We are #innthistogether and together, we can continue our incredible work.
title: Great Yarmouth & Lowestoft PI Team

charity.description: We fundraise to enhance Great Ormond Street Hospital’s ability to transform the health and wellbeing of children and young people. Donations help to fund advanced medical equipment, child and family support services, pioneering research and rebuilding and refurbishment.
charity.name: Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity
story:
Great Ormond Street Hospital has lost over £20 million this year in charitable donations (due to covid) yet over 600 very ill children still arrive every day for life-changing treatments. In these challenging times we must not forget about the super heroes fighting for their lives.

We are hosting a 24 hour yoga marathon to raise money for this incredible children's hospital. 

Your support in any or ALL of the following ways would be greatly appreciated:

1. register for FREE yoga classes at www.yoga4gosh.com 

2. ask your friends to register for FREE yoga classes at www.yoga4gosh.com 

3. donate money to GOSH at www.justgiving.com/yoga4gosh

4. ask your friends and family to donate money to GOSH at www.justgiving.com/yoga4gosh

5. share both links on your social media and help us SPREAD THE WORD!

charity.description:
We are the world’s largest charity dedicated to saving lives through research.
Our vision is to bring forward the day when all cancers are cured.

Cancer Research UK is a registered charity in England and Wales (1089464), Scotland (SC041666), the Isle of Man (1103) and Jersey (247).
charity.name: Cancer Research UK
charity.registrationNumber: in England and Wales 1089464, Scotland SC041666
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

2020 is turning out to be the strangest year I have experienced in my 52 years, COVID has meant a close look at life and how I was living it re health, diet and general well being.

Starting with walks leading to short runs in April with a view to make sure if hit by COVID I was in a position to fight it off the best I could, since then I have lost 3 stone in weight and can now run 5k in 29 mins and have recently completed a 10k in 64 mins, still plan to lose another stone and get regularly under the hour for 10k.

During this period I lost a good friend to cancer, Steve Cleeve who I had known for 30 years through business, he fought so hard but lost his battle in September, I had the honour to attend his funeral which only 30 people were allowed to be there due to COVID restrictions (thank you Julie) sitting there brought back memories of lost family members, my Dad to who was lost to lung cancer in 2015, again another fighter, heart of a lion but one fight he couldn’t win and my mother in law Maurs lost to pancreatic cancer in 2013, I’m wearing the hat she bought me for Christmas in my profile picture!!😊 cheers Maurs very cosy!

As COVID continues to pile pressure on the NHS cancer sufferers struggle to either pluck up the courage to seek treatment because they are scared of catching COVID in hospital or their treatment is delayed due to the current demands on the health care system.

Any donation to CRUK means we could be one step further in fighting a disease that has been around long before COVID came along causing so much damage in 2020.

Every mile I run I will donate a pound, I plan to do this from 11th November 2020 to 11th November 2021 (entered the Lytham remembrance 10k which will be a fitting end to this round of fundraising) I will also grow my usual ‘Movember’ moustache to keep me warm on the way!!!

Any donation would be gratefully received and could help save lives of a family member, friend or even just another human being!

Thank you for reading, stay safe. 👍

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Thank you for any donations you make.

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I took on this challenge at the beginning of October in memory of all of those lives cruelly taken too soon by cancer. I lost a dearly loved uncle to cancer, have many friends who have lost their parents to cancer and only this year saw cancer steal the life of my inspirational headteacher. 

I have only one more week to go and have completed 22.6 miles through twice weekly runs but would love your support to push me through the last miles as my knees are really beginning to feel it!

eventName: Live Stream - The One Hundred Shows Of Helm
story:
My name is Helm. I am a musician from Cornwall.

I have been playing online gigs since March when the music scene started to close down. I am a gigging musician who, like many others, have been unable to work. I began on the day that we lost Kenny Rogers and I played some of his songs to anyone that wanted to listen via a Facebook live stream. This spiralled out of control and now, unbelievably, I am approaching my 100th show all this time on. The show will take place on Friday 30th October.

The 50th show was a great event for me which attracted a whole pile of views mostly because of local radio exposure and the fans that I have amassed during the course of the shows. I never for a moment imagined that I would make it to 50 shows let alone 100. I am trying to get the 100th show to be even bigger. 

I will be raising money for ‘Help Musicians’ and for ‘Cancer Research’ charities that both have a significant meaning to me and my family.

Thank you in advance for any donations you give.

You can watch the show on my Facebook page on Friday 30th of October at 7pm UK time.

Www.facebook.com/helm.devegas

Thanks for caring.

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
charity.registrationNumber: 207994 (England & Wales) and SC038731 (Scotland)
story:
Maggie loved life and life loved her right back. But as she put it, that 'bastard cancer' got in the way. When it got bad, the good people at the Marie Curie hospice in Glasgow provided her with so much support, care and love. She was so grateful and called it her lovely hotel.

It meant so much to us, her family, that she was able to feel comforted and secure, even when COVID stopped us from being able to visit. To know that the nurses, doctors and cleaners were all there for her meant so much.

So instead of any flowers or other memorials, please do feel free to donate to Marie Curie. Every penny counts and Maggie would approve. Then please raise a glass and celebrate a great life, well lived, with love. xxx

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

story:
June Mary Beeston passed away on Wednesday 21st October after suffering from lung cancer. 

June was strong and positive to the end. She impacted so many lives and made a lasting impression on everyone she met.

She was the best and most fun Mumsy, Grandy, Junie and friend anyone could have and she will be missed so much.

May she live on in our hearts forever and put a smile on our faces when we think of her.

June loved flowers but would be happier with donations to this fabulous charity who supported her to the end.

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I am running a 24 hour challenge in memory of my Grandpa McCrabbe who passed away nearly 2 weeks ago. Marie Curie supported my Grandpa and my family through the toughest months of all of their lives. My Grandpa was so unwell and in a lot of pain but kept he's sense of humour throughout. We also shared the same birthday. Nice surprise for him being a grandad for the first time :) I used to go and stay with him in Ireland, 4 weeks out of the 6 weeks school holidays and every day for those 4 weeks I would eat mash potato for lunch (I loved it)

So... what better way to remember my grandpa than running a 24 hour challenge in his memory. 

Again thank you for taking the time to read this and an even bigger thank you for donating. I really do appreciate it <3

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
charity.registrationNumber: 207994 (England & Wales) and SC038731 (Scotland)
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Between 10th and 18th September 2021 I am taking part in a magnificent trek in some of the most spectacular national parks in the Canadian Rockies, including Banff and Yoho as well as the vibrant city of Calgary. 

I signed up for this challenge back in February of this year as I needed something to focus on. I wanted to pick something that would be a challenge as well as help with the provision of care for more people living with a terminal illness. 

I am lucky to be joined by my partner in adventure, Angela Mckenzie. We had great fundraising ideas in place which have unfortunately all been pushed to the sidelines due to Covid-19 restrictions. We are working on alternative online and virtual fundraising ideas so please bear with us whilst we get creative! Over the coming months look out for some online Lucky Squares and auctions and hopefully some fun activities 🤞

Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.description: RNLI volunteer lifeboat crews provide a 24-hour search and rescue service all around the UK and Ireland, while lifeguards keep a careful watch on the UK’s busiest beaches. RNLI lifesaving and drowning prevention depend on supporter fundraising and the generous donations that you and others give.
charity.name: RNLI - Royal National Lifeboat Institution
eventName: Halloween Tarot Fun for the RNLI
story:
Thank you for visiting my JustGiving page. 
RNLI lifeboats in Yorkshire and the North East protect hundreds of communities through our 24-hour search and rescue service. They rely on the safest, most reliable lifeboats and modern stations to launch from. 
We rely on donations from you the public to continue saving lives at sea - your donation to this page will help support the running of lifeboat stations in Yorkshire and the North East.

We’re the world’s leading independent conservation organisation. And we’re building a future where people and nature thrive together. 

That’s why we’re passionate about sharing the planet’s resources more sustainably, tackling climate change and protecting endangered wildlife.
charity.name: WWF-UK
eventName: Felix & Teddy's Half Term Litter Picking
story:
We want to clean up our local streets and parks to make it nicer for everyone and to raise some money to help animals around the world.

WWF is at the heart of global efforts to address the world’s most important environmental challenges: safeguarding the natural world, tackling climate change and enabling people to use only their fair share of natural resources. Together we can build a future where people and nature thrive.Your support is much appreciated.Find out more by visiting wwf.org.uk

charity.description:
We’re the world’s leading independent conservation organisation. And we’re building a future where people and nature thrive together. 

That’s why we’re passionate about sharing the planet’s resources more sustainably, tackling climate change and protecting endangered wildlife.
charity.name: WWF-UK
story:
Hi there! I'm Alexandria and I'll be freezing my arse off for charity! It might sound crazy, but hear me out. I received an email from the WWF telling me how since 1970, wildlife populations have gone down by an average of 68%. After stamping on my heart, they told me that luckily I could do something to help called the Big Winter Wander! Basically, on the 24th of January next year I'll be walking 20km in the Kirkhill Forest, to hopefully raise £100 for the WWF. 

I think we could all agree that in recent times (due to a certain virus), nature has been something we've grown to appreciate more. For some of us, a walk outside might be one of the only things to bring peace and leave us feeling positive in a time so scary. I have personally found joy in spotting creatures local to our home Scotland, like the red squirrel, robins and even badgers! But if we don't try to change the course of our impact on the environment and the world we live in, we might not have the privilege of getting into nature one day, or the chance to point out all of these amazing little creatures to our friends, family, or even our own children. Scotland and its local nature is something I love and care about so much, and the thought of it suffering or eventually disappearing is deeply upsetting. 

So that's why I'll be doing this walk. I'm doing it for our future. I would be so grateful for any support, in the form of a donation, or company on my walk. My family will be joining me, and there is plenty of room for friends too. I'm hoping to point out some particularly interesting pieces of nature, and make it a fun walk for everyone. Message me if you're interested! if you decide to donate, thank you so much. It really does make a difference.
title: Alexandria's Big Winter Wander
rememberedPersonSummary.name: NA
pageSummary: I am walking 20km because I love Scotland's nature, and I want it to stay
pageSummaryWhy: I love Scotland's nature, and I want it to stay
media.images.image.caption: NA

charity.description:
We’re the world’s leading independent conservation organisation. And we’re building a future where people and nature thrive together. 

That’s why we’re passionate about sharing the planet’s resources more sustainably, tackling climate change and protecting endangered wildlife.
charity.name: WWF-UK
story: IF YOU GO DOWN TO THE WOODS TODAY... You might notice theres less wildlife than there used to be. Thats because half of all UK species are in decline were losing our precious red squirrels, hedgehogs and birds at an alarming rate. By taking part in The Big Winter Wander, you and your friends and family can reconnect with our country's beautiful wildlife and help protect it. The funds you raise will help us campaign to protect wildlife here, and around the world. Nature has been there to offer us comfort during difficult times, and now its our time to give back.
